Description: Fragmentary border of a furnishing textile in undyed linen plain weave with, at the lower part, five rows of loops (4cm long/1 every 5 picks); c. 2cm above is a band of tapestry, the end on the right is preserved (with simple selvedge)and depicts a beige rabbit orientated to the left, on a purple background; two medallions remain, one in the centre is decorated with a basket in yellow, orange and purple, and full of green vegetal motifs and white, pink and red flowers; the medallion on the left is decorated with a tree, leaves and branches in blue and fruits or flowers? in purple and orange; between the medallion are three heart-shaped leaves alternatively red and green; the band is framed above and below with two triangle freizes in purple; one simple selvedges remains and the other edges are cut; plain weave: undyed linen (S/22), weft-undyed linen (S/9); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/8), weft-undyed linen (S/36), purple, yellow, orange, pink, red, green, blue wool (S/72)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
